analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lce'i 'dus te reg pa dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “They should not abide in the notion that the composite of contact at the tongue is calm, or that it is not calm.

translated: “They should not abide in the notion that the composite of contact at the tongue is empty, or that it is not empty.🔽“They should not abide in the notion that the composite of contact at the tongue is with signs, or that it is signless.

analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lce'i 'dus te reg pa smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “They should not abide in the notion that the composite of contact at the tongue is having aspirations, or that it is without aspirations.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lus kyi 'dus te reg pa rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lus kyi 'dus te reg pa rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “They should not abide in the notion that the composite of contact at the body is permanent, or that it is impermanent.

analyzed: dmigs @427b pa'i tshul gyis lus kyi 'dus te reg pa bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “They should not abide in the notion that the composite of contact at the body is happiness, or that it is suffering.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lus kyi 'dus te reg pa bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lus kyi 'dus te reg pa bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: In a similar vein, they should not abide in the notion that tactile objects are empty, or the notion that tactile objects are not empty.🔽“Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings, while practicing the transcendent perfection of wisdom, should not abide in the notion that the eyes are with signs, or the notion that the eyes are signless.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lus kyi 'dus te reg pa sdug ces bya ba dang / mi sdug ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lus kyi 'dus te reg pa sdug ces bya ba dang / mi sdug ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: In a similar vein, they should not abide in the notion that the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mental faculty are with signs, or the notion that the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mental faculty are signless.🔽“Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings, while practicing the transcendent perfection of wisdom, should not abide in the notion that the eyes are with wishes, or the notion that the eyes are wishless.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lus kyi 'dus te reg pa zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lus kyi 'dus te reg pa zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: In a similar vein, they should not abide in the notion that the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mental faculty are with wishes, or the notion that the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mental faculty are wishless.🔽“Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings, while practicing the transcendent perfection of wisdom, should not abide in the notion that the eyes are entities, or the notion that the eyes are non-entities.

translated: In a similar vein, they should not abide in the notion that the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mental faculty are entities, or the notion that the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mental faculty are non-entities.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lus kyi 'dus te reg pa smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lus kyi 'dus te reg pa smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not abide in the notion that the composite of tactile sensations is pure,🔽or in the notion that it is impure.🔽“One should not abide in the notion that the composite of tactile sensations is empty,🔽or in the notion that it is not empty.🔽“One should not abide in the notion that the composite of tactile sensations is with a nature of self,🔽or in the notion that it is without a nature of self.🔽“One should not abide in the notion that the composite of tactile sensations is calm,🔽or in the notion that it is not calm.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid kyi 'dus te reg pa rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid kyi 'dus te reg pa rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //

analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid kyi 'dus te reg pa bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //

analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid kyi 'dus te reg pa bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not abide in the notion that the composite of tactile sensations is with a nature of being empty,🔽or in the notion that it is with a nature of not being empty.🔽“One should not abide in the notion that the composite of tactile sensations is with a nature of being with signs,

analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid kyi 'dus te reg pa dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “In a manner of objectification one should not dwell on the idea that mental contact is void or not void.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid kyi 'dus te reg pa stong zhes bya ba dang / mi stong zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid kyi 'dus te reg pa stong zhes bya ba dang / mi stong zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “In a manner of objectification one should not dwell on the idea that mental contact is empty or not empty.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid kyi 'dus te reg pa mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid kyi 'dus te reg pa mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “In a manner of objectification one should not dwell on the idea that mental contact has a sign or is signless.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid kyi 'dus te reg pa smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid kyi 'dus te reg pa smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “In a manner of objectification one should not dwell on the idea that mental contact has a predilection or is without predilection.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “In a manner of objectification one should not dwell on the idea that feeling conditioned by sensory contact that is visually compounded is a self or not a self.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //🔽dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o // dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “In a way that involves apprehending something, they should not dwell on the feeling that arises from the condition of contact through the union of eye, form, and eye-consciousness as blissful or suffering.🔽“In a way that involves apprehending something, they should not dwell on the feeling that arises from the condition of contact through the union of eye, form, and eye-consciousness as a self or not a self.

translated: “In a way that involves apprehending something, they should not dwell on the feeling that arises from the condition of contact through the union of eye, form, and eye-consciousness as having a soul or as being without a soul.🔽“In a way that involves apprehending something, they should not dwell on the feeling that arises from the condition of contact through the union of eye, form, and eye-consciousness as attractive or unattractive.🔽“In a way that involves apprehending something, they should not dwell on the feeling that arises from the condition of contact through the union of eye, form, and eye-consciousness as calm or not calm.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba stong zhes bya ba dang / mi stong zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba stong zhes bya ba dang / mi stong zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //

translated: “They should not dwell, in an apprehending manner, on the idea that the feeling that arises from the condition of the contact of the eye is with signs, or that it is signless.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “They should not dwell, in an apprehending manner, on the idea that the feeling that arises from the condition of the contact of the eye is having aspirations, or that it is without aspirations.

translated: “One should not abide in the notion that name and form are a self or that they are not a self.🔽“One should not abide in the notion that name and form are beautiful or that they are ugly.🔽“One should not abide in the notion that name and form are empty or that they are not empty.🔽“One should not abide in the notion that name and form are with signs or that they are signless.🔽“One should not abide in the notion that name and form have aspirations or that they are without aspirations.🔽“One should not abide in the notion that name and form are calm or that they are not calm.🔽“One should not abide in the notion that name and form are void or that they are not void.

translated: “One should not abide in the notion that the emptiness of non-applicability is calm, or that it is not calm.🔽“One should not abide in the notion that the emptiness of non-applicability is void, or that it is not void.🔽“One should not abide in the notion that the emptiness of non-applicability is afflicted, or that it is purified.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //🔽dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dngos po med pa stong pa nyid stong zhes bya ba dang / mi stong zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //

translated: “One should not abide in the notion that the emptiness of non-applicability is either existent or non-existent.🔽“One should not abide in the notion that the emptiness of non-applicability is either empty or not empty.🔽“One should not abide in the notion that the emptiness of non-applicability is either with signs or signless.🔽“One should not abide in the notion that the emptiness of non-applicability is either with wishes or wishless.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dngos po med pa stong pa nyid mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dngos po med pa stong pa nyid mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not abide in the notion that the emptiness of non-applicability is either having an entity or not having an entity.🔽“One should not abide in the notion that the emptiness of non-applicability is either produced or unproduced.🔽“One should not abide in the notion that the emptiness of non-applicability is either destroyed or not destroyed.🔽“One should not abide in the notion that the emptiness of non-applicability is either increasing or decreasing.🔽“One should not abide in the notion that the emptiness of non-applicability is either taken up or laid down.🔽“One should not abide in the notion that the emptiness of non-applicability is either manifest or unmanifest.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dngos po med pa stong pa nyid smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //🔽dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dngos po med pa stong pa nyid smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //🔽dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: “One should not abide in the notion that the emptiness of non-applicability is either past, future, or present.🔽“One should not abide in the notion that the emptiness of non-applicability is either connected or not connected with the other five kinds of emptiness.

analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //

translated: “One should not abide in the notion that the bases of supernatural powers are empty or not empty.🔽“One should not abide in the notion that the bases of supernatural powers are with signs or signless.

translated: “One should not abide in the notion that the bases of supernatural powers have aspirations or are without aspirations.

original: mi rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not abide in the notion that the faculties are permanent or impermanent.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dbang po rnams bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dbang po rnams bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not abide in the notion that the faculties are happiness or suffering.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dbang po rnams bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dbang po rnams bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not abide in the notion that the faculties are a self or not a self.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dbang po rnams sdug ces bya ba dang / mi sdug ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //🔽dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dbang po rnams zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dbang po rnams sdug ces bya ba dang / mi sdug ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o // dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dbang po rnams zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “In a manner of objectification one should not dwell on the idea that the faculties are pleasant or unpleasant.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dbang po rnams dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dbang po rnams dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o /
translated: “In a manner of objectification one should not dwell on the idea that the faculties are calm or not calm.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dbang po rnams stong zhes bya ba dang / mi stong zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dbang po rnams stong zhes bya ba dang / mi stong zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “In a manner of objectification one should not dwell on the idea that the faculties are void or not void.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dbang po rnams mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dbang po rnams mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “In a manner of objectification one should not dwell on the idea that the faculties are with signs or signless.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dbang po rnams smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dbang po rnams smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “In a manner of objectification one should not dwell on the idea that the faculties are with wishes or wishless.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis stobs rnams rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis stobs rnams rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: In a similar vein, they should not dwell, in an apprehending manner, on the notion that the powers are permanent or that they are impermanent.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis stobs rnams bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis stobs rnams bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not dwell, in an apprehending manner, on the notion that the powers are imbued with happiness or that they are imbued with suffering.

analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis stobs rnams bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not dwell, in an apprehending manner, on the notion that the powers are a self or that they are a non-self.

analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis stobs @449b rnams sdug ces bya ba dang / mi sdug ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //

translated: “One should not abide in the notion that the correct understandings are empty or not empty.🔽“One should not abide in the notion that the correct understandings are with signs or signless.🔽“One should not abide in the notion that the correct understandings are having aspirations or without aspirations.🔽“One should not abide in the notion that the correct understandings are calm or not calm.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not abide in the notion that the correct understandings are void or not void.🔽“One should not abide in the notion that the correct understandings are afflicted or purified.🔽“One should not abide in the notion that the correct understandings arise or are destroyed.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis so so yang dag par rig pa rnams stong zhes bya ba dang / mi stong zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis so so yang dag par rig pa rnams stong zhes bya ba dang / mi stong zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not abide in the notion that the correct understandings are entities or non-entities.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis so so yang dag par rig pa rnams mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis so so yang dag par rig pa rnams mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not abide in the notion that the correct understandings are with signs, or that they are signless.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis so so yang dag par rig pa rnams smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis so so yang dag par rig pa rnams smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not abide in the notion that the correct understandings are with aspirations, or that they are without aspirations.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byams pa chen po rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byams pa chen po rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not abide in the notion that great love is eternal, or that it is transient.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byams pa chen po bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byams pa chen po bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not abide in the notion that great love is happiness, or that it is suffering.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byams pa chen po bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byams pa chen po bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not abide in the notion that great love is a self, or that it is a non-self.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byams pa chen po sdug @456b ces bya ba dang / mi sdug ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byams pa chen po sdug @456b ces bya ba dang / mi sdug ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not abide in the notion that great love is beautiful, or that it is ugly.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byams pa chen po zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byams pa chen po zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “In a way that objectifies, they should not dwell on great love as calm or not calm.

analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byams pa chen po dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “In a way that objectifies, they should not dwell on great love as void or not void.

translated: “The fruit of a non-returner” should not be objectified as calm or not calm.🔽“The fruit of a non-returner” should not be objectified as void or not void.🔽“The fruit of a non-returner” should not be objectified as afflicted or purified.🔽“The fruit of a non-returner” should not be objectified as arising or ceasing.🔽“The fruit of a non-returner” should not be objectified as being with defilements or being without defilements.🔽“The fruit of a non-returner” should not be objectified as being with or being without an essence.🔽“The fruit of a non-returner” should not be objectified as being empty or not empty.🔽“The fruit of a non-returner” should not be objectified as with signs or signless.🔽“The fruit of a non-returner” should not be objectified as having aspirations or lacking aspirations.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “The fruit of an arhat” should not be objectified as permanent or impermanent.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu bde @458b zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu bde @458b zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “The fruit of an arhat” should not be objectified as happy or suffering.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not abide with the notion that ‘the effect of non-returning is a self,’ or ‘it is not a self.’

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu sdug ces bya ba dang / mi sdug ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //🔽dmigs pa'i tshul gyis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu sdug ces bya ba dang / mi sdug ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o // dmigs pa'i tshul gyis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not abide with the notion that ‘the effect of non-returning is attractive,’ or ‘it is unattractive.’🔽“One should not abide with the notion that ‘the effect of non-returning is peaceful,’ or ‘it is not peaceful.’

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not abide with the notion that ‘the effect of non-returning is void,’ or ‘it is not void.’

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu stong zhes bya ba dang / mi stong zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu stong zhes bya ba dang / mi stong zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not abide with the notion that ‘the effect of non-returning is empty,’ or ‘it is not empty.’

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not abide with the notion that ‘the effect of non-returning has a core,’ or ‘it is without a core.’

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not abide in the notion that the fruit of non-returning is with desire or that it is without desire.

analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dgra bcom pa nyid rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not abide in the notion that the fruit of arhatship is permanent or that it is impermanent.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dgra bcom pa nyid bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dgra bcom pa nyid bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not abide in the notion that the fruit of arhatship is happiness or that it is suffering.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dgra bcom pa nyid bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dgra bcom pa nyid bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not abide in the notion that the fruit of arhatship is a self or that it is not a self.

analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dgra bcom pa nyid sdug ces bya ba dang / mi sdug bsngal bya bar gnas par mi bya'o /
translated: “One should not abide in the notion that the fruit of arhatship is beautiful or that it is ugly.

analyzed: @459a *// dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dgra bcom pa nyid zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not abide in the notion that the fruit of arhatship is calm or that it is not calm.

translated: “They should not abide in the notion that ‘the state of an arhat is calm,’ or that ‘it is not calm.’

analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dgra bcom pa nyid stong zhes bya ba dang / mi stong zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “They should not abide in the notion that ‘the state of an arhat is empty,’ or that ‘it is not empty.’

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dgra bcom pa nyid mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dgra bcom pa nyid mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “They should not abide in the notion that ‘the state of an arhat is with signs,’ or that ‘it is signless.’

analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dgra bcom pa nyid smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //

analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rang byang chub rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //

analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rang byang chub bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “They should not abide in the notion that ‘a pratyekabuddha’s awakening is happiness,’ or that ‘it is suffering.’

analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not abide in the notion that the knowledge of path aspects is permanent, or that the knowledge of path aspects is impermanent.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not abide in the notion that the knowledge of path aspects is happiness, or that the knowledge of path aspects is suffering.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not abide in the notion that the knowledge of path aspects is a self, or that the knowledge of path aspects is not a self.

translated: “I will perfect the transcendent perfection of meditative concentration” should not be conceptualized.

translated: “I will perfect the transcendent perfection of wisdom” should not be conceptualized.🔽“I will perfect the applications of mindfulness” should not be conceptualized.

translated: “I will perfect the correct exertions” should not be conceptualized.

translated: “I will perfect the bases of supernatural power” is not the way you should practice.🔽“I will perfect the faculties” is not the way you should practice.

original: stobs rnams yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: stobs rnams yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “I will perfect the powers” is not the way you should practice.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
translated: “A bodhisattva great being

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa lnga la gnas te /

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la blta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur ba dang / chos mnyan pa dang / thos nas kyang de bzhin nyid du gzhan la bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshad med grangs med par 'gro'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
translated: “Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing ji 'dra ba de 'dra ba nyid du yongs su bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //

analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med par song ste /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la me tog dang / phreng ba dang dri dang byug pa dang phye ma dang chos gos @462b dang gdugs dang rgyal mtshan dang ba dan mang pos rim gror bya'o //

analyzed: bkur stir bya'o // phu dud du bya'o //

original: mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod par bya'o //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la na bza' bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po dag gis kyang mchod par bya'o zhes bya ba de ltar yang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la na bza' bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po dag gis kyang mchod par bya'o zhes bya ba de ltar yang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: They should make offerings to those tathāgatas with many quintillions of garments. ’ In that way also, they should not abide in a way that apprehends.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can tshad med grangs med pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rab tu dgong par bya'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can tshad med grangs med pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rab tu dgong par bya'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: ‘I should bring countless, innumerable sentient beings to complete nirvāṇa in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening. ’ In that way also, they should not abide in a way that apprehends.

original: mig lnga bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: mig lnga bsgrub par bya ste /

analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /

translated: The fleshly eye, the divine eye, the wisdom eye, the Dharma eye, and the buddha eye.

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad yongs su bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas bar mi bya'o //

analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad yongs su bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “I will accomplish all the dhāraṇī gateways” — one should not abide in that way.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu yongs su bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //

translated: “I must accomplish the four assurances,” he should not abide in that way, and so on up to

analyzed: yongs su bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o // byams pa chen po yongs su bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “I must accomplish the four kinds of exact knowledge,” he should not abide in that way, and so on up to🔽“I must accomplish the fourfold fearlessness,” he should not abide in that way, and so on up to🔽“I must accomplish great love,” he should not abide in that way, and so on up to

analyzed: snying rje chen po yongs su bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //

analyzed: lus la skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis yongs su bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “I must accomplish the thirty-two major marks of a great person on my body,” he should not abide in that way, and so on up to

analyzed: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //

analyzed: brgyad pa'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //

analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //

analyzed: po zos na lan bdun pa'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //

analyzed: rigs nas rigs su 'gro ba'o zhe 'am /

analyzed: @463b gang zag mgo mnyam pa'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //

original: tshe zad pa'o zhe 'am /
analyzed: tshe zad pa'o zhe 'am /
translated: “Life is exhausted” or

analyzed: nyon mongs pa zad pa'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “afflictions are exhausted” — one should not abide in that way, by way of apprehending something.

analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One who has entered the stream” — one should not abide in that way, by way of apprehending something.
